output_list.criticism: The mint function allows the preSale contract to mint an arbitrary amount of DSPX tokens and assign them to arbitrary addresses, causing an integer overflow in the totalSupply variable, which can be exploited to increase the balance of any user to an arbitrary value. This vulnerability is severe because it can be exploited by the preSale contract owner to steal funds from any user. Additionally, the vulnerability is highly correctness because it is a logic error in the mint function, causing an integer overflow in the totalSupply variable.
output_list.extra_info: The vulnerability is exploitable in real world because it can be triggered in real token economy. The incentive for attackers is to steal funds from users, which can be traded in black market. The attackers are the preSale contract owner, who has minting permission.
